article_title: U.S. Retail Sales Flat in July
article_text:
A standstill in the nation's retail sector in July showed the U.S. economy struggling to lift off as improvement in the labor market fails to deliver stronger wage and spending growth.

Retail sales last month were essentially unchanged from June after adjusting for seasonal differences, the Commerce Department said Wednesday. Americans spent more at clothing and grocery stores but scaled back spending at auto dealerships and...
